writing_prompt: Every morning, Will Solace wakes up next to Nico di Angelo, the love of his life, and every morning begins with laughter, kisses, and the occasional battle to get out of bed—until one day, Nico suggests something that changes their routine forever.
story:
Mornings with Nico were a ritual I cherished. Our bedroom was a sanctuary, filled with the soft glow of morning light filtering through the curtains, and the warmth of our bodies entwined under the covers. I woke up to the sound of Nico's gentle snores, a symphony that always made me smile. I snuggled closer, my nose buried in the crook of his neck, and inhaled the scent of his skin. He stirred, his eyes fluttering open, and a lazy grin spread across his face.

"Good morning, sunshine," he mumbled, his voice husky from sleep.

I chuckled, my lips brushing against his ear. "You're the sunshine, Nico. I'm just the darkness that follows you everywhere."

Nico rolled his eyes, but his smile deepened. "Oh, please. You're the one who brightens up my day."

Our morning banter was a well-rehearsed dance, a playful exchange of witty remarks and affectionate jabs. But today, Nico's tone shifted, his voice taking on a more serious note.

"Hey, Will? Can we talk?"

I propped myself up on an elbow, my brow furrowed in concern. "What's up?"

Nico's eyes sparkled with mischief. "I was thinking... we should start a new morning ritual."

I raised an eyebrow. "Oh? What did you have in mind?"

Nico's grin returned, and he launched into a dramatic monologue, complete with sweeping gestures and an over-the-top tone. "We shall begin each day with a magical feast! A breakfast of champions, fit for the gods!"

I laughed, unable to resist his infectious enthusiasm. "A magical feast, you say? What kind of food would we serve at this feast?"

Nico's eyes gleamed. "Well, we could have ambrosia pancakes, with nectar-infused syrup and a side of golden apples. And, of course, a dollop of Mount Olympus whipped cream!"

I chuckled, shaking my head. "You're ridiculous, you know that?"

Nico pouted, but his eyes sparkled with amusement. "Hey, it's a great idea! And we could make it even more special by setting up a little altar in our room, with a tiny statue of Hermes and a few candles."

I couldn't help but be charmed by Nico's creativity. "You know what? I like it. But only if we can have a pillow fight to start the day."

Nico's face lit up. "Deal!"

And so, our new morning ritual was born. We spent the next hour setting up our little altar, laughing and joking as we worked. We lit the candles, and the soft glow illuminated our faces, casting a warm, golden light over our little sanctuary.

As we sat down to our magical feast, Nico reached out and took my hand, his eyes shining with love. "I'm so glad we're doing this, Will. I want every day to start with a little bit of magic, and a whole lot of love."

I smiled, my heart full. "Me too, Nico. Me too."

writing_prompt: Your partner insists you can look through their phone anytime, but when you do, you discover a collection of candid photos of yourself—each one capturing a moment you didn’t even realize was special.
story:
I was waiting for dinner to cook, scrolling through my phone to pass the time, when I decided to take Will up on his offer to snoop through his phone anytime I wanted. He always said I could look, but I never took him up on it. Tonight, however, I was bored, and my curiosity got the better of me.

As I flipped through his photos, I expected to see the usual stuff – campfire selfies, scenic views of the beach, and maybe some memes he'd saved for later. But what I stumbled upon was a collection of candid photos of me. Not just any photos, but moments I didn't even realize were special.

There was a picture of me laughing so hard I was crying, taken during a particularly ridiculous game night with the gang. I had no memory of Will even taking it. Another photo showed me lost in thought, staring out at the ocean during a solo walk on the beach. I recalled that day, but I had no idea Will had been watching me from afar.

My thumb scrolled through the album, and I found myself smiling at each new photo. There was one of me attempting to cook breakfast, with a giant flour cloud exploding in the background. Will had captioned it " Domestic Disaster." I chuckled, remembering that morning and how Will had teasingly called me a " culinary catastrophe."

As I delved deeper into the album, the photos became more poignant. There was a picture of me sleeping, with a soft, peaceful expression on my face. Will had taken it during a particularly tough time, when I was struggling with nightmares. I didn't know he'd been watching over me, capturing that moment of vulnerability.

I felt a lump form in my throat as I realized the significance of these photos. They weren't just random snapshots; they were a collection of moments that showcased our relationship, our laughter, and our quiet moments together.

"Hey, what's got you so engrossed?" Will asked, plopping down beside me on the couch.

I hesitated, unsure if I should reveal my discovery. But something about his warm smile put me at ease. "I was just looking through your phone," I admitted, showing him the album.

Will's eyes crinkled at the corners as he smiled. "Ah, you found the secret art project."

"Secret art project?" I raised an eyebrow.

"Yeah, I've been collecting those moments for a while now. I love how they capture the real you – not just the hero of the demigod world, but the person you are when you think no one's watching."

My heart swelled with emotion as I looked at the photos again, this time with newfound appreciation. "These are... us," I said, my voice barely above a whisper.

Will nodded, his eyes shining with warmth. "They are. And I love every moment of it."

We sat there in comfortable silence for a moment, the photos still open on the screen between us. Then, without thinking, I leaned over and kissed him, the phone slipping from my fingers.

As we pulled away, Will smiled, his eyes sparkling. "I'm glad you found the photos. I was hoping you'd see how much you mean to me."

I smiled back, feeling a deep sense of connection. "I think I'm starting to understand."

In that moment, surrounded by the warm glow of the kitchen and the soft hum of the evening, I knew that these candid photos had captured something truly special – the beauty of our everyday moments, and the love that made them extraordinary.

writing_prompt: A mischievous makeup artist convinces their reluctant partner to star in a video, only to reveal a hilariously unexpected transformation—what happens next?
story:
I trudged into the makeup studio, dropping my bag onto the floor with a dramatic sigh. "I don't know why I let you talk me into this, Nico," I said, flopping onto the chair in front of the mirror.

Nico, my partner and resident makeup genius, grinned mischievously as he began rummaging through his collection of colorful palettes and quirky makeup tools. "Come on, Will, it'll be fun! You're always saying I'm a genius with makeup. Now's your chance to be my canvas."

I raised an eyebrow, skeptical. "I said you're a genius, not a mad scientist. What's the theme of this video, anyway?"

Nico's grin only grew wider. "I was thinking...a Greek god. You know, for a little inspiration from the gods."

I rolled my eyes good-naturedly. "You and your Greek obsession. Fine, but if I end up looking like a total idiot, I'm blaming you."

Nico held up his hands, a dramatic flourish. "I promise, my love, you will be the most dashing, debonair god the world has ever seen. Apollo himself would be jealous."

I snorted. "Yeah, right. And I'm sure the millions of viewers will just love my 'dashing' face covered in glitter and feathers."

Nico chuckled, beginning to work his magic. As he applied layer after layer of colorful makeup, I couldn't help but laugh at his antics. He narrated the entire process with exaggerated flair, making even the most mundane steps sound like a grand adventure.

Finally, after what felt like an eternity, Nico stepped back to admire his handiwork. I glanced in the mirror, and my jaw dropped.

I was...a chicken.

Not just any chicken, mind you. A gleaming, golden chicken with iridescent feathers and a glittering beak. I stared, aghast, as Nico burst into laughter.

"I...I don't even know what to say," I managed, trying to process the...fowl...transformation.

Nico wiped tears from his eyes, still chuckling. "I told you, you'd be a natural! And just think, now you can cluck your way to internet fame."

I face-palmed, laughing despite myself. "You're ridiculous, you know that?"

Nico grinned, coming over to wrap his arms around me. "Hey, that's why you love me. Now, are you ready for your close-up, Mr. Chicken?"

I shook my head, still laughing, but couldn't help the warmth that spread through my chest. Maybe, just maybe, this video wouldn't be so bad after all.

writing_prompt: While navigating the Labyrinth, Nico encounters a strange, freckled boy claiming to be from the future—and his future boyfriend.
story:
I trudged through the Labyrinth, my eyes fixed on the map in my hand. The twisting paths seemed to shift and writhe like a living thing, making it impossible to get a clear sense of direction. I muttered to myself, trying to keep my bearings. "Left at the third intersection, right at the fourth... no, wait, was it the other way around?"

As I turned a corner, I almost collided with a boy who seemed to appear out of nowhere. He was a bit taller than me, with a messy mop of brown hair and a scattering of freckles across his cheeks. He grinned at me, and I felt a jolt of surprise.

"Hey, watch where you're going, demigod!" he said, chuckling. "You're going to get yourself killed."

I raised an eyebrow. "Demigod?" I repeated. "How did you know?"

The boy shrugged. "I know a lot of things. My name is Max, by the way. And you are...?"

"Nico di Angelo," I replied, trying to process this sudden encounter.

Max's eyes lit up. "Nico di Angelo! I've heard so much about you."

I raised an eyebrow. "What do you mean?"

Max leaned in, a mischievous glint in his eye. "I'm from the future, Nico. And in my time, you and I... well, let's just say we're a thing."

I stared at him, my mind reeling. "What? That's impossible."

Max shrugged. "Time travel is a real pain, trust me. But I'm here to tell you that we're meant to be. You and me, we're... destiny."

I snorted. "Destiny? You expect me to believe that?"

Max grinned. "Hey, don't knock it till you try it, okay? Besides, I've got proof."

He pulled out a small device from his pocket, and I recognized it as some kind of futuristic gadget. "This is a temporal communicator," he explained. "It lets me send messages to my past self. And I've got a message from you, Nico."

He handed me the device, and I hesitated for a moment before taking it. The screen flickered to life, displaying a message in my own handwriting.

"Hey Max," the message read. "I'm so glad you're here. I was starting to think I was going crazy. -Nico"

I stared at the message, my mind racing. This was impossible. And yet... a part of me wanted to believe it.

Max leaned in, his voice low. "See, Nico? We're meant to be. And I'm not going to let a little thing like time get in the way."

I felt a shiver run down my spine as he smiled at me. Maybe, just maybe, this was the start of something real.

As we navigated the Labyrinth together, Max regaling me with stories of our future adventures, I couldn't help but wonder if this was indeed my destiny. And if so, I was ready to face it head-on.

The Labyrinth's twisting paths seemed to shift and writhe around us, but with Max by my side, I felt a sense of certainty I'd never felt before. Maybe, just maybe, I was ready to take a chance on the future.

As we walked, the stone walls echoing with whispers of the past, I turned to Max and smiled. "So, what's it like in the future?"

Max grinned. "It's amazing. And with you by my side, it's going to be even better."

I felt a spark of excitement ignite within me, and I knew that I was ready to face whatever the future held – as long as Max was there to face it with me.

writing_prompt: After surviving the horrors of Tartarus, Will and Nico have developed quiet rituals to soothe their lingering fears. One sleepless night, they find themselves dancing in the kitchen, holding each other close as the weight of their shared past fades into the rhythm of the present.
story:
The kitchen clock ticked away, its rhythmic pulse echoing through the stillness of the night. Will and Nico sat at the table, their eyes fixed on the soft glow of the kitchen light, casting gentle shadows on the walls. It was a quiet evening, the kind that made you feel like the world outside had melted away, leaving only the two of them, suspended in this small, safe space.

Nico fidgeted with his sock, his eyes drifting to Will's feet. "You're wearing the blue ones again," he said, a hint of a smile playing on his lips.

Will chuckled, his eyes crinkling at the corners. "Hey, they're comfortable."

Nico snorted. "You're just trying to drive me crazy with your mismatched socks."

The tension in the air dissipated, and Will reached out, his hand brushing against Nico's. "Maybe a little," he said, his voice low and soothing.

As they sat there, the hum of the refrigerator and the creaks of the old house created a symphony of sounds that felt almost comforting. It was a familiar melody, one that reminded them of all the nights they'd spent together, waiting for the dawn to come.

Nico's eyes met Will's, and without a word, they stood up, their bodies swaying to the rhythm of the kitchen. It was a slow, gentle dance, one that they'd developed over the months, a way to calm the lingering fears that still haunted them.

As they moved, the shadows on the walls seemed to fade, replaced by the soft glow of the kitchen light. The clock's ticking grew louder, its pulse matching the beat of their hearts.

"Remember when we thought we'd never see the stars again?" Nico whispered, his voice barely audible over the music in their heads.

Will's hand tightened around Nico's waist. "I remember," he said, his voice low and husky.

Their dance became a waltz, a slow, sweeping motion that filled the kitchen with a sense of magic. The mundane space transformed into a sanctuary, a place where they could leave their fears behind and just be.

As they twirled, Nico's eyes locked onto Will's, and for a moment, they forgot about the horrors of Tartarus. They forgot about the darkness and the pain. All that mattered was this moment, this dance, this feeling of being alive.

The music in their heads grew louder, a gentle melody that seemed to match the beat of their hearts. It was a song they'd heard on the radio once, a song that had become their own private anthem.

As they danced, the world outside receded, and all that was left was the two of them, swaying to the rhythm of their own private world. The kitchen clock ticked away, a steady heartbeat that underscored the music in their heads.

In this moment, they were free. Free from the past, free from their fears. All that mattered was this dance, this moment, this feeling of being together.

As the music faded, they slowed to a stop, their chests heaving in unison. Nico's eyes met Will's, and they shared a smile, a smile that spoke of healing, of love, of the quiet rituals that had become their own private salvation.

"We're okay," Nico whispered, his voice barely audible.

Will's hand tightened around his waist. "We're okay," he repeated, his voice low and soothing.

In that moment, they knew they'd face whatever came next, as long as they had each other.
